p: Some previous studies have already focused on the insecticidal activities of essential oils and leaf extracts from L. camara of different origins [ 19, 20, 27, 35, 36, 59, 60]. As examples, powdered leaves of L. camara from the Philippines showed a high repellency for Sitophilus zeamais [ 19], while methanolic extract from India and Egyptian leaf essential oils were toxic to Sitophilus oryzae and Tribolium castaneum [ 35, 59]. Two studies have also already demonstrated the toxicity of Algerian L. camara essential oils on S. granarius, showing that mortality increased with higher concentrations and temperatures [ 20] and that the essential oil becomes inefficient a long time after fumigation [ 36]. However, the tests used to show the toxicity in those studies were different to the present work.
